Gerente de Relacionamento PJ Alto Valor - São Paulo

  • Gerenciar relacionamento com cooperados pessoa jurídica alto valor;
  • Prestar atendimento de qualidade aos cooperados, visando suprir suas necessidades;
  • Realizar visitas de prospecção de cooperados novos;
  • Divulgar e comercializar produtos e serviços da cooperativa, visando o cumprimento das metas;
  • Identificar oportunidades de negócios e desenvolver estratégias para aumentar a carteira de cooperados; e
  • Realizar análise de mercado e concorrência para identificar tendências e oportunidades;

Requisitos

  • Cursando Pós-graduação em Administração, Ciências Contábeis, Economia ou áreas afins;
  • Certificação ANBIMA; e
  • Indispensável vivência como Gerente de Relacionamento PJ.
Anuênio Auxílio Creche/Babá Auxílio Educação Convênios Empréstimo Consignado Gratificação Natalina Plano de Incentivo de Metas Plano de Saúde Plano Odontológico Seguro de Vida Sicoob Universidade Vale-Alimentação Vale-Refeição Vale-Transporte

Sobre a empresa

Somos o Sicoob Credicapital , em 2023, celebramos 22 anos de história. São duas décadas de muitos desafios e conquistas. Começamos com uma pequena cooperativa, dentro da Associação Comercial de Cascavel e hoje, temos aproximadamente 50 mil cooperados e 42 pontos de atendimento no Paraná, Rio Grande do Sul e São Paulo.

Esse crescimento é reflexo do aumento de empresários, comerciantes, agricultores e profissionais de outras áreas, que escolheram a cooperativa como instituição financeira. Além, é claro, do compromisso e comprometimento dos mais de 400 colaboradores que fazem parte da família Credicapital.

Estamos cheios de esperança e com o comprometimento de construir mais uma década de vitórias, que seja marcada pelo melhor relacionamento com nossos cooperados e colaboradores, para que juntos possamos continuar conectando pessoas para promover justiça financeira e prosperidade!

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior Software Engineer Manager CODE
description:
Your wellbeing matters. Join a company that cares.

GET TO KNOW US

Wellhub (formerly Gympass*) is a corporate wellness platform that connects employees to the best partners for fitness, mindfulness, therapy, nutrition, and sleep, all included in one subscription designed to cost less than each individual partner. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 countries. At Wellhub, you have the opportunity to build a career in a high-growth tech company that places wellbeing at the foundation of its culture, and contribute to making every company a wellness company.

*Big news: Gympass is now Wellhub!
We are thrilled to announce our rebranding as Wellhub, marking a significant milestone in our journey. This transformation reflects our evolution from a “pass for gyms” to a comprehensive employee wellbeing solution. With our refreshed identity, we are poised to embark on an exciting new chapter of growth and expansion. We are elevating our offerings, including a completely new app experience and an expanded network of wellbeing partners.

THE OPPORTUNITY

We are hiring a Senior Software Engineering Manager for our CODE team in Brazil!

As a Senior Software Engineering Manager , you will lead some of our growth-focused teams, guiding tech leads and fostering an environment of technical excellence and strong team dynamics. Your role is pivotal in shaping the engineering and product development landscapes, ensuring that our technical strategies align seamlessly with business objectives. You will develop a vision for the CODE Ecosystem, drive architecture decisions that impact our entire development interactions, and work with cutting-edge technologies on a global scale.

CODE is an acronym for Consumer Digital Experience, which means we're in charge of the experience and services that will guide people's wellbeing journey. Our main goal in CODE is to make wellbeing universal. From knowing about Wellhub and getting access to exclusive benefits to using our vast partner's network, it is in the end-user experience.

CODE teams are responsible for developing and maintaining Wellhub's App, frontend, backend services, and design system. We work closely with product, UX, and data teams to create an excellent experience for our platform's users.

YOUR IMPACT

  • Develop and communicate a clear vision for the CODE Ecosystem, ensuring alignment across all engineering teams;
  • Drive architecture decisions that impact our entire CODE development interactions, setting standards for performance, scalability, and resilience;
  • Oversee and mentor tech leads, providing guidance on architectural decisions, establishing technical standards, and recommending tools and methodologies that enhance collaborative and efficient outcomes;
  • Support existing systems by enhancing functionality, increasing scale, and transforming them to meet our product demands;
  • Work in a collaborative and agile environment that prioritizes people over process and is laser-focused on productivity;
  • Work with cutting-edge technologies and edge cases on a global scale;
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product Management, to ensure that engineering efforts align with product goals and business strategies;
  • Act as a bridge between the engineering teams and other stakeholders, facilitating clear and effective communication;
  • Drive data-driven decision-making processes, ensuring that metrics and KPIs guide engineering priorities and resource allocation;
  • Live the mission: inspire and empower others by genuinely caring for your own wellbeing and your colleagues. Bring wellbeing to the forefront of work, and create a supportive environment where everyone feels comfortable taking care of themselves, taking time off, and finding work-life balance.

WHO YOU ARE

  • You are a technical professional with a passion for software and product development;
  • You are accountable for your decisions and possess a high level of ownership over the products you are delivering;
  • You are proactive, innovative, and data-driven, value facts and data when making product decisions;
  • Expertise with at least two programming languages, such as Java, Scala, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, or Golang;
  • Expertise with SQL/NoSQL technology such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, DynamoDB, understanding common use cases and performance pitfalls;
  • Solid experience dealing with event-driven architectures and message brokers such as RabbitMQ, KAFKA, ActiveMQ, etc, and an in-depth understanding of their use cases and pitfalls;
  • Experience in managing managers of software engineering teams;
  • Versed in concepts such as DDD, SOLID, Design Patterns, distributed systems, and architecture. Capable of understanding pitfalls and anticipating common failure modes of a microservice environment;
  • Experienced in implementing prototypes and in practices and concepts such as MVP, A/B testing, and feature toggles for rolling out features to production;
  • Strong communication skills: able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders in English and Portuguese;
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent professional experience;

We recognize that individuals approach job applications differently. We strongly encourage all aspiring applicants to go for it, even if they don't match the job description 100%. We welcome your application and will be delighted to explore if you could be a great fit for our team. For this specific role, please note that prior experience in managing managers of software engineering teams and solid experience dealing with event-driven architectures are mandatory requirements.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and well-being of our employees. Our flexible program allows you to customize your benefits, according to your needs!

Our benefits include:

WELLNESS: Health, dental, and life insurance.

FLEXIBLE WORK: At Wellhub, flexibility fosters a happier, healthier, and more productive work environment for everyone. As a Flexible First company, we offer two work model options: flexible hybrid and full remote, and make the office a place for collaboration, community, and team building. The model for this role can be discussed with your recruiter and hiring manager. We offer all employees a home office stipend and a monthly flexible work allowance to help cover the costs of working from home.

FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: Wellhubbers and their leaders can make the best decisions for their scope. This includes flexibility to adjust their working hours based on their personal schedule, time zone, and business needs.

WELLHUB: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to find their passion too. Access onsite gyms and fitness studios, digital fitness programs, and online wellness resources for meditation, nutrition, mental health support, and more. You will receive the Gold plan at no cost, and other premium plans will be significantly discounted.

PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is that our employees take time away from work to recharge.

Vacations after 6 months and 3 days off per year + 1 day off for each year of tenure (up to 5 additional days) + extra day off for your birthday.

PAID PARENTAL LEAVE: Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life and we want our employees to take the time to be present and enjoy their growing family.

100% paid parental leave of 6 weeks to all new parents, of both biological and adopted children, regardless of gender and parent's relationship with the co-parent. Also extended maternity leave under local legislation.

CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.

CULTURE: An exciting and supportive atmosphere with ambitious people from around the world! You’ll partner with global colleagues and share in the success of a high-growth technology company disrupting the health and wellness space. Our value-based culture of trust, flexibility, and integrity makes this possible every day.

Diversity, Equity, and Belonging at Wellhub

Wellhub is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

title: Coordenador de Educação e Negócio (Governança Educacional) – RP14854 (14854)
description:
Coordenador de Educação e Negócio (Governança Educacional) – RP14854

Sistema Fiep também é sinônimo de Educação e Capacitação. Unindo formação empreendedora, professores experientes e unidades distribuídas pelo Paraná, o Sistema Fiep prepara crianças, jovens e adultos para os desafios acadêmicos e profissionais.
Se você deseja contribuir com o nosso propósito, de transformar o Paraná no melhor lugar para a indústria no Brasil, esta vaga pode ser sua!

Qual é a posição?

Coordenador de Educação e Negócio (Governança Educacional) – RP 14854 - Sesi Sede - Curitiba/PR

Quais são os desafios e as principais responsabilidades

  • Gerenciar e otimizar processos, compras e atividades administrativas da área de Educação Profissional (SENAI), garantindo a conformidade com políticas e procedimentos;
  • Supervisionar os contratos vinculados à Gerência de Educação Profissional (SENAI), desde o fechamento até o faturamento, assegurando que todos os termos e condições sejam cumpridos;
  • Realizar o monitoramento mensal dos indicadores de produção e orçamento dos serviços de Educação Profissional (SENAI), colaborando com a gerência e as unidades para garantir a precisão e a conformidade;
  • Avaliar os custos dos produtos da educação profissional, trabalhando em estreita colaboração com áreas correlatas para definir a precificação de produtos e propostas;
  • Participar ativamente na construção das diretrizes do Planejamento Orçamentário dos serviços de Educação e na condução do fechamento do orçamento anual, tanto da gerência corporativa, quanto das unidades distribuídas no estado do Paraná;
  • Conduzir análises de viabilidade de negócios, desenvolver projeções futuras e elaborar apresentações para suporte à gestão;
  • Atuar nos processos de faturamento que envolvem mais de uma unidade ou parceiros estratégicos, assegurando a precisão e a eficiência nas transações;
  • Acompanhar as áreas corporativas e as unidades no desenvolvimento de projetos estratégicos, aplicando Metodologia Ágil e sistema de validação cíclica por OKR;
  • Mapear e avaliar fluxos de processos para garantir a atuação eficiente na rotina de operações da Educação Profissional (SENAI);
  • Gerenciar riscos operacionais a partir do mapeamento, otimização e qualificação dos fluxos de processos;
  • Construir, desdobrar e acompanhar o Planejamento Estratégico institucional e da gerência executiva do SENAI;
  • Conduzir e apoiar a construção e consolidação de indicadores, direcionadores, habilitadores e outros artifícios estratégicos da atuação institucional;
  • Constituir e qualificar painéis de indicadores baseados em big data da operação estratégica educacional do SENAI;
  • Gerenciar recursos tecnológicos, como Power BI, para manipulação de dados oriundos da rotina escolar (educação profissional).

Quais são os principais requisitos?

  • Desejável graduação Administração, Economia, Contabilidade entre outras;
  • Desejável Pós-graduação na área de gestão de projetos, Administração, Gestão por indicadores ou áreas afins;
  • Desejável conhecimento básico em Metodologia Ágil, Sistema de indicadores e Power BI;
  • Experiência em rotinas administrativas, planejamento orçamentário, estudos de viabilidade financeira, custo e precificação de produtos;
  • Experiência em gestão de equipes e atividades de natureza educacional;
  • Carteira de habilitação B;
  • Disponibilidade de horários e possíveis viagens;
  • Desejável Pacote Office Avançado - especialmente Excel;
  • Para candidatos internos, atender aos critérios de elegibilidade NG 0077 (4.5.4).

Fique por dentro de alguns detalhes sobre esta oportunidade:

Local de trabalho: Av. Cândido de Abreu, 200 - Centro Cívico, Curitiba - PR, 80530-000

Horário: 09:00 às 12:00 e das 13:30 às 18:00 (Segunda a sexta-feira) - 40 horas semanais

Etapas do processo seletivo (todas eliminatórias):

  1. Triagem RH
  2. Triagem do Gestor
  3. Avaliação de Conhecimento (Case ou Prova de Conhecimento)
  4. Solicitação documentos comprobatórios
  5. Entrevista RH
  6. Entrevista de Validação
  7. Admissão

Ficou interessado? Candidate-se e boa sorte!

O prazo para inscrição neste processo seletivo é do dia 28/08/2024 a 08/09/2024.

Essa vaga também se destina a pessoas com deficiência (PCD) ou reabilitados(as).

Este processo seletivo tem validade de 24 meses, podendo ocorrer o aproveitamento de candidatos aprovados em novas oportunidades deste mesmo perfil, seguindo a ordem de classificação.

title: Tax Technology Manager - Latam
description:
This job posting isn't available in all website languages.

If you are a person with a disability and need assistance applying for a job, please submit a request.

At Trane Technologies and through our businesses including Trane and Thermo King, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.

What’s in it for you:

Trane Technologies is looking to recruit a LATAM Indirect Tax Technology Manager , based in Mexico to join its Global Indirect Tax Technology Team. The manager will lead the Tax Technology practice in the region and will interact with key stakeholders for the implementation of Tax systems in LATAM, such as Vertex O Series, OneSource, and Oracle R12. The manager will also implement innovative solutions for indirect Tax compliance across the LATAM region such as the Sovos compliance software, as well as other data analytical and reconciliation solutions. This position will report to the Global VAT & Tax Technology leader.

Thrive at work and at home:

Thrive at work and at home, through meaningful benefits, flexibility, and opportunities for growth. We offer comprehensive benefits to support our employees and their families including:

  1. You will have the opportunity to participate in the Company's private medical and life insurance program prior to meeting eligibility requirements, following the policies, terms, and conditions set by the Company. The coverage and conditions for employees and their family members may vary based on the location.
  2. You will also have access to the all-inclusive Wellbeing Program , which provides resources to support the emotional, legal, and financial well-being of you and your family.
  3. The Company offers continuous learning opportunities through its continuing education programs.
  4. Additionally, you will be granted one full day (8 hours) of paid time off per calendar year to volunteer with non-profit charitable organizations through the Employee Volunteerism program.
  5. In cases of unforeseen personal hardship, the Trane Technologies Helping Hands Fund is available to provide support to employees facing financial challenges.

Where is the work:
This position is eligible for a hybrid work schedule (3 or more days onsite per week) based out of Naucalpan Office.

What you will do:

  1. Leading the LATAM Technology practice, focusing on VAT and indirect tax systems in LATAM and being a key back-up to the Global Tax Technology Leader for any Indirect Tax Strategic Technology matters.
  2. Responsibility for the LATAM Tax Technology aspects of the Oracle R12 / Tax engine’s implementation (i.e. Vertex O Series and OneSource), leading the efforts for jurisdictions such as Mexico, Brazil, and other jurisdictions in the region. Ensuring all aspects of Indirect Taxes are covered in the roll-out of the phases of Oracle R12 / Tax engines in LATAM including but not limited to:
    1. Indirect tax requirements gathering.
    2. Solution design / fit-gap analysis with existing platform.
    3. Support of the technical resources for the build.
    4. Design testing scenarios and take responsibility for the testing.
    5. Provide training on the solution.
    6. Assist cut-over and troubleshooting exceptions.
    7. Maintenance of the production systems, including developing, implementing, and managing the appropriate processes and performing any tasks relating to the maintenance / update of the systems, as well as troubleshooting tax issues in conjunction with the other stakeholders.
  3. Key Lead for the deployment of compliance tools and solutions for LATAM, such as Sovos or Thomson Reuters solutions, etc.
  4. Implementing any new LATAM Indirect Tax Technology requirements and leading projects on any new Tax digitization requirements in LATAM such as e-invoicing and other real-time reporting requirements (CFDI, e-reports, etc.).
  5. Implementation of best practices in terms of systems and processes for cross-functional projects.
  6. Establish good working relationships with all stakeholders both in tax (Global tax technology, corporate tax SMEs) and outside tax (Finance, Business, Oracle core team, etc.).

What you will bring:

  1. Preferably a master’s degree in Economics, Finance, or IT.
  2. A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience with large-scale Tax Technology projects and deployments in a multinational environment.
  3. Prior experience with Vertex O Series, OneSource, or Avalara Tax engines - a Vertex or Thomson Reuters Certification is strongly preferred.
  4. Knowledge of Oracle ERP and SQL and/or PL/SQL required.
  5. Knowledge of analytical and reconciliation tools such as Alteryx, Power BI, Tableau, Dataiku.
  6. Strong knowledge of the LATAM Indirect Tax legislations (i.e. VAT and other systems), especially the Mexican VAT system.
  7. Team player with excellent analytical skills as well as interpersonal and communication skills.
  8. Very organized, systematic, process-driven person.
  9. Hands-on, problem solver, result-oriented, and focused on customer satisfaction.
  10. Ability to manage and work independently on competing assignments.
  11. Fluent in Spanish and English, and any other language such as Portuguese is an asset.

We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs. We are an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status.

title: Solutions Architect - Brazil
description:
Before jumping in on all the information about the role and what you can bring to the table, let us introduce ourselves real quick.

About us

We are Insider, a B2B SaaS company that drives growth for its clients around the world. How are we achieving this? We are the #1 AI-native platform for Customer Experience and Marketing—offers marketers a single platform to deliver unique experiences per person, drive profitable growth, and unleash peak productivity and efficiency. Our platform connects data across channels, predicts future behavior with AI, and individualizes experiences from a single platform. We’ve unlocked unicorn status following our Series D round. We are backed by top-notch investors, including Sequoia Capital, QIA, Riverwood, and Endeavor Catalyst, and trusted by 1200+ brands from high-growth startups to the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies such as Samsung, Coca Cola, Nike, L’Oreal, Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Nestle, Nissan, Lenovo, Puma, IKEA, Allianz, Dominos, Avon, CNN, and the list goes on.

Having recently unlocked unicorn status, Insider was congratulated for becoming one of the only woman-founded, women-led B2B SaaS unicorns in the world, to achieve $200M USD in CARR (Committed Annual Recurring Revenue). Insider was named a leader in the The Forrester Wave for Cross-Channel Campaign Management 2021, and Leader in the IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Omnichannel Marketing Platforms for B2C Enterprises 2023 Assessment. The company has been recognized in The Top 1% of all software companies worldwide in G2’s 2024 Software Awards, and named in The Top 10 Best Software Products with the most #1 rankings alongside other software legends like Google, Zoom, and Monday.com . According to G2’s Spring’24 reports. Insider is also the #1 G2 Leader in 6+ categories, including Customer Data Platforms (CDP), Personalization Engines, Personalization Software, Mobile Marketing, Customer Journey Analytics, and eCommerce Personalization.

When our team founded Insider, they not only sought to create a product company, but to build the most socially progressive technology community in the world. Through our corporate social responsibility initiatives like 100projects shecodes, sheleads and shemarkables, our community has committed to scaling its impact into our communities across 27+ countries, spearheading transformative projects in areas such as health, education, farming, animal rights, and increasing the proportional representation of women in STEM careers.

Behind all these achievements, there is an exceptionally talented and passionate team across 27+ countries that moves fast and agile, creates cutting-edge products, and focuses on making an impact. If you want to join us on this journey, just keep reading.

Our Partner Success Team consists of people from 31 different nationalities. They are how we thrive. They are our story makers. They are quick learners & problem solvers. They are the master problem solvers, they resolve, they care and they ignite. Each of them is part of harmonious teamwork that follows meaningful goals. Our Technical Account Managers are powered by their technical background and skills. They aim to provide seamless onboarding for our Partners while assisting with implementation. They are problem-solvers, strategic thinkers. They are the core when it comes to making sure that Partners are flawlessly onboarded for the maximum efficiency for Insider products. Until now it has been an inspiring story on our side, so we wanted to let you in on it. Now? Now we are looking to expand our team!

Job Description

  • Proactively engages with and reaches out to customer technical decision makers and influencers. Utilizes information on customer business, industry, needs, competitive landscape and key priorities to support customer's digital transformation.
  • Run data workshops to build plans for implementing solutions which align to customer business goals and technical environments.
  • Drives pilots, proof of concept (POC), and value (e.g., optimizing solutions and costs) and moves the customer forward from pilots to productive deployments by rooting pilots in business impact.
  • Troubleshoots technical issues reported by customers during the implementation and ongoing campaign deployment process and provide solutions.
  • Identifies, escalates, and works to resolve technical blockers (e.g., changing configurations, sample coding) to accelerate architecture implementations, and routes non-technical issues for removal by appropriate party.
  • Proactively engages product and support teams (e.g., engineering) to remediate blockers by conveying impact.
  • Leverage best practices to guide customer strategy and future growth for Insider by cultivating customer affinity with Insider solutions that drive impact for the customer.

What we expect from you?

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in consultative/complex technical deployment projects, architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications.
  • Proven track record of building deep technical relationships with senior IT executives in large or highly strategic accounts.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to orchestrate, lead, and influence virtual teams, ensuring successful implementation of customer projects.
  • Extensive technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management.
  • Familiarity, awareness, or strong working knowledge of development methodologies and technologies in one or more of the following: JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS; REST, XML, Database Technologies.
  • You have strong product command and technical domain knowledge of one or more of the following: SaaS, Marketing, Mobile Applications, APIs or Programming.

While we are conquering the world, we are offering you;

  • a chance to work in an international, diverse, and inclusive environment,
  • “Tech Talks” with famous and groundbreaking people from the software world,
  • to be part of an industry that’s shaping the future of customer experiences. Don't believe us? Just ask Google,
  • access and opportunity to gain a limitless network all over the globe
  • access to many hard and soft skills pieces of training to help you improve and challenge yourself,
  • access to 16,000+ online courses taught by real-world professionals on the LinkedIn Learning platform to satisfy your hunger for knowledge.
  • space to share your skills through training sessions and workshops if you wish. Sharing is caring!
  • fun with the occasional team activities!
  • No Dress Code!

We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.

Please follow Insider on LinkedIn , Instagram , Youtube, and Medium !

title: Mobile Engineer (Brazil, All Levels)
description:
Sezzle is a U.S. based company listed on NASDAQ. Salary ranges are:

  • Senior: $4,700 - $7,500 USD per month
  • Mid: $3,500 - $5,500 USD per month
  • Junior: $2,200 - $3,500 USD per month

About Sezzle:

Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose long-standing mission is to financially empower the next generation. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores.

About the Role:

Sezzle has an incredible opportunity to make an impact within a growing FinTech company. As a Software Engineer I focused on our mobile app, you will be responsible for solving challenges in our highest-traffic applications, with your work having a direct impact on our customers and product. Day-to-day, you’ll partner with your team to build out features and products in our React Native-based mobile app.

What You'll Do:

  • Work within our cross-platform TypeScript React Native app to build and maintain new innovative product features.
  • Actively learn new areas of the product, and collaborate with owners for different product features to gain insight and offer constructive suggestions for improvements.
  • Be an active participant in design/architecture discussions sharing your ideas while building the next generation of features for the Sezzle platform.
  • Hands-on with our codebase and a contributor to code reviews.
  • Work with the team to continuously build clean, scalable, robust, and testable code.
  • Assist in planning, estimations, and completion for projects brought up by the team stakeholders.

What We Look For:

  • Experience solving technical problems as part of a team.
  • Bachelor's in computer science (preferred) or equivalent related experience.
  • Familiarity with modern Frontend Development, Javascript or Typescript, with React Native or React (web) experience strongly preferred.

Preferred Knowledge and Skills:

  • Experience developing and delivering a mobile application to a mobile app store (App Store or Google Play Store).
  • Knowledgeable in writing automated tests for applications (unit, integration, end-to-end).
  • Familiar with the basic principles and design of React Native Apps, and RESTful APIs.
  • Close familiarity with software engineering tools, software development methodology, and release processes.

About You:

  • You have relentlessly high standards .
  • You’re not bound by convention .
  • You need action .
  • You earn trust .
  • You have backbone; disagree, then commit .
  • You deliver results .

What Makes Working at Sezzle Awesome:

At Sezzle, we are more than just brilliant engineers, passionate data enthusiasts, out-of-the-box thinkers, and determined innovators. Our culture is not defined by a certain set of perks designed to give the illusion of the traditional startup culture, but rather, it is the visible example living in every employee that we hire.

Compensation:

Our ranges are very broad to accommodate all types of candidates and encourage growth. Specific compensation offered to a candidate may be dependent on factors such as education, experience, qualifications, and alignment with market data. Exceptional candidates may receive salaries outside of the posted ranges.

Equal Employment Opportunity: Sezzle Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Coordenador (a) Qualidade
description:
Selecione a frequência (em dias) de recebimento de alertas: Criar alerta

Modelo de trabalho: presencial em Cubatão

Apresentação da área

Na Yara contribuímos diariamente para a construção de uma sociedade cada vez mais colaborativa, um mundo sem fome e um planeta respeitado. Criamos impacto positivo usando a economia como o motor da mudança para um crescimento sustentável. Trabalhar na Yara significa contribuir para: produção sustentável de alimentos para uma crescente população mundial, reduzir o impacto nas mudanças climáticas, reduzir o consumo de água e energia e melhorar a saúde humana.
O segmento Industrial da Yara, converte a energia, os minerais naturais e o nitrogênio do ar em produtos essenciais para atender às necessidades da Indústria. Nossos produtos possuem múltiplas aplicações, desde o abatimento de emissões de poluentes, redução de odores e nutrição animal, até ingredientes-chave na produção de uma ampla linha de produtos industriais.

Descrição da posição | Responsabilidades

  • Liderar a gestão do time de Controle de Qualidade, garantindo as competências desde a contratação, capacitação e desenvolvimento do time conforme a estratégia do negócio;
  • Planejar e implementar a estratégia da área de Controle de Qualidade, considerando pessoas, equipamentos, insumos, conhecimento e capacidade;
  • Lidera a gestão do orçamento (Budget) e investimentos (CAPEX) do LCQ;
  • Realizar o gerenciamento de requisitos legais aplicáveis a área de Qualidade;
  • Liderar a análise, investigação, plano de ação e apresentações dos eventos de Laboratório;
  • Conduzir análises de riscos e garantir a conformidade com procedimentos e processos de qualidade e analíticos;
  • Assegurar a investigação de Resultados Fora de Especificação, reclamações de clientes externos e desvios internos, além de garantir a execução do plano de ação e os relatórios apropriados;
  • Apoiar a equipe de SGI na implementação de dashboards e outras ferramentas que possibilitem a gestão e visualização dos resultados e indicadores do laboratório e da qualidade;
  • Conduzir Análises de Causa Raiz (RCA) referentes a desvios analíticos;
  • Acompanhar a qualidade do produto em armazéns internos e/ou externos.
  • Lidera a equipe de Qualidade nas questões de importação e exportação de produtos;
  • Garantir a atualização dos indicadores de qualidade e tratativa dos indicadores que não atendam a meta;
  • Implementar programas de Boas Práticas de Laboratório (BPL / ISO 17025);
  • Avaliar ocorrências e turnos, tomando ações para evitar recorrências;
  • Lidera implementação e/ou manutenção do LIMS;
  • Elaborar relatórios gerenciais e dashboards para garantir o monitoramento e análise de indicadores de performance do laboratório.

Perfil | Formação e conhecimentos

  • Espírito de colaboração, protagonismo, curiosidade, senso de dono e respeito às diferenças;
  • Graduação concluída em Química, Química Industrial, Engenharia Química, Farmácia ou afins;
  • Pós graduação na área de Qualidade será um diferêncial;
  • Experiência efetiva comprovada em posições de liderança de qualidade;
  • Inglês - avançado ou Fluente;
  • Compreensão e resolução de problemas em sistemas de cromatografia líquida/gasosa;
  • Conhecimento intermediário de LIMS e SAP;
  • Conhecimento de Ferramentas de investigação de Causa Raiz;
  • Conhecimento de Power BI, Smartsheet ou ferramentas correlatas;
  • Conhecimento Avançado de Análise estatística de dados;
  • Certificação em metodologias Lean Six sigma ou Agile;
  • Conhecimento em ISO 9001, 14001, 45001;
  • Conhecimento em boas práticas de laboratório (BPL).

Informações adicionais

A Yara está comprometida em criar um ambiente diverso e inclusivo e se orgulha de ser uma empresa que oferece oportunidades iguais para todos. Acreditamos em um ambiente de trabalho onde nossos colaboradores se sintam à vontade para ser quem são, estimulando a diversidade e a pluralidade de pensamento. Para isso, ancoramos firmemente a Diversidade e Inclusão (D&I) em nossa estratégia de negócio e temos mais de 400 colaboradores em todo o mundo envolvidos como agentes de D&I.

title: Senior Engineer
description:
Advert 2H Offshore is a global engineering contractor specializing in the design, engineering and integrity management of offshore structures, topsides facilities, subsea components and riser and conductor systems for the offshore oil and gas and renewables sectors. Both market sectors require similar engineering skill sets, and our breadth of experience in offshore structures and environments allows us to provide expertise at all stages of a project: feasibility and concept design, detailed design, procurement management, fabrication support, installation support, monitoring, integrity management, asset life extension and decommissioning.
2H Offshore is looking to add a Senior Engineer to their expanding team in Rio de Janeiro. As a Senior Engineer, you will be part of or lead and manage multi-disciplinary project teams (of typically up to 5 people) across a wide variety of projects, encompassing engineering design and analysis at the conceptual, feasibility, FEED, detailed design, and/or installation stages of riser and conductor projects. You will take a leading role on these projects and develop strong and close working relationships with our engineering team and our clients founded on a personal approach and technical excellence. You will take joint responsibility to lead, support and develop engineers to deliver the technical excellence 2H expect across a wide variety of riser and renewable projects.
The successful candidate will be based in the Rio de Janeiro area.
**Please submit Resumes/CVs in English.
Duties
•Report writing
•Proposal writing
•Communication of technical results and conclusions to other members of the team and clients through meetings, presentations and written reports
•Leadership and project management of scopes of work
Required
•Degree in relevant engineering degree (mechanical, civil, petroleum, chemical)
•Typically, 3+ years of subsea engineering experience, but other engineering backgrounds will be considered
•Minimum 3 years’ experience in the oil and gas market
•Fluent English
•Track record of undertaking either riser analysis, mooring analysis, conductor analysis, installation analysis or similar in OrcaFlex or Flexcom
•Experience with:
oDrilling, completion or production riser systems (flexible, rigid or hybrid)
oFloating wind power cables or mooring analysis
oDesign or integrity management as a differentiator
•Ability and enthusiasm to perform tasks and achieve results with a high degree of accuracy and precision
•Ability to work independently, strong sense of personal accountability and self-motivation as well as collaboratively within a team
•Capability to oversee and review dynamic structural based design work, interpreting results to form sound engineering judgements and recommendations
•Excellent communicator, in both written and verbal forms, with highly effective inter-personal skills supported by good attention to detail
•Desire and ambition to achieve both technical and personal excellence by committing to personal and professional development

description:

Para você que deseja contribuir com o nosso propósito, de transformar o Paraná no melhor lugar para a indústria no Brasil, esta vaga pode ser sua!

Qual é a posição?

Quais são os desafios e as principais responsabilidades?

  • Liderar e motivar equipes técnicas, promovendo o desenvolvimento de talentos e garantindo que todos trabalhem em direção aos mesmos objetivos;
  • Implementar programas de treinamento contínuos para garantir a atualização técnica dos colaboradores;
  • Fomentar uma cultura de colaboração, inovação e melhoria contínua dentro da equipe;
  • Gerenciar projetos de TI, com foco em prazos, orçamento e qualidade;
  • Definir metas claras e acompanhar os KPIs para medir o desempenho da equipe e dos projetos;
  • Assegurar a eficiência nos processos de suporte e operação dos sistemas de TI, garantindo altos níveis de disponibilidade e desempenho;
  • Coordenar a implementação, manutenção e otimização de ERPs;
  • Trabalhar em conjunto com outras áreas da empresa para garantir que o ERP atenda às necessidades do negócio e que melhorias sejam constantemente implementadas;
  • Liderar processos de integração de novos módulos ou funcionalidades, assegurando o alinhamento com as demandas da organização.

Requisitos

Gostou? Então verifique se você possui os requisitos abaixo:

  • Desejável formação superior nas áreas de Tecnologia, Administração, entre outras;
  • Especialização será um diferencial;
  • Ter habilidade com liderança, experiência em gestão de equipes de TI de médio a grande porte será um diferencial;
  • Experiência em implementação e gestão de ERPs de mercado;
  • Habilidade para gerenciar múltiplos projetos simultaneamente, mantendo o foco na entrega de resultados;
  • Capacidade de comunicação eficaz com stakeholders em diferentes níveis hierárquicos;
  • Mentalidade inovadora, com foco contínuo em aprimorar processos e implementar novas soluções tecnológicas;
  • Desejável possui CNH B ativa e disponibilidade para viagens.

title: Product Manager Senior
description:
Como Product Manager Senior, você será o responsável por liderar a estratégia e execução de produtos voltados para a integração de sistemas críticos que suportam nossa operação de fulfillment. Você trabalhará em estreita colaboração com equipes multifuncionais, buscando garantir que nossas soluções integrem eficientemente os diferentes sistemas envolvidos no processo logístico, proporcionando uma experiência perfeita e escalável para todos os usuários.

Responsabilidades:

  • Desenvolver e Executar Estratégia de Produto: Definir a visão e estratégia para soluções de integração, alinhando o roadmap com as necessidades do negócio e dos clientes. Priorização será guiada por análise de mercado, feedbacks e demandas operacionais.
  • Liderar Equipes Multifuncionais: Colaborar com times de engenharia, operações e parceiros externos para assegurar a execução bem-sucedida das integrações, facilitando a comunicação e o alinhamento entre todas as partes envolvidas.
  • Gestão de Ciclo de Vida do Produto: Supervisionar todas as etapas do ciclo de vida do produto, desde o planejamento, desenvolvimento, testes e implementação até o lançamento e manutenção. Identificar oportunidades para otimizar processos e melhorar a eficiência operacional ao longo do tempo.
  • Análise de Mercado e Competição: Realizar pesquisas e acompanhar tendências para garantir que nossas soluções de integração estejam à frente do mercado, ajustando a estratégia conforme necessário para continuar inovando.
  • Gestão de Performance e KPIs: Definir e monitorar indicadores de sucesso, garantindo que as soluções entreguem resultados em termos de eficiência operacional e satisfação do cliente.
  • Foco na Experiência do Cliente: Garantir que as soluções criadas proporcionem uma experiência superior para todos os envolvidos, desde os operadores até os clientes finais, e que os feedbacks recebidos sejam transformados em melhorias contínuas.

Requisitos:

  • Formação: Graduação em áreas como Administração, Engenharia, Sistemas de Informação ou correlatas. Pós-graduação ou MBA são diferenciais.
  • Experiência: Pelo menos 5 a 7 anos de experiência em gestão de produtos, com foco em integrações de sistemas e operações logísticas. Experiência prévia em projetos de integração entre múltiplos sistemas é fundamental.
  • Habilidades Técnicas: Conhecimento sólido em metodologias ágeis e ferramentas de gerenciamento de produtos. Capacidade de entender a complexidade de integrações de sistemas e traduzi-las em soluções eficientes.
  • Comunicação: Excelentes habilidades de comunicação para trabalhar com diferentes públicos e influenciar decisões em todas as fases do desenvolvimento do produto.
  • Análise e Solução de Problemas: Capacidade de analisar processos e dados complexos, identificando problemas e propondo soluções práticas e inovadoras.
  • Liderança: Experiência em liderar equipes por influência e gerenciar projetos multifuncionais, motivando e alinhando todos em torno de metas claras e alcançáveis.

O que oferecemos:

  • Benefícios VA/VR: No Cartão Flash, você usa como quiser;
  • Plano de saúde Amil;
  • Plano Odontológico;
  • Plano Pet da Petlove;
  • Descontos especiais com a Esalq Usp e outras instituições de ensino (Queremos potencializar o seu desenvolvimento!);
  • TotalPass;
  • Licença maternidade/paternidade contínua;
  • Creche auxiliar;
  • Dia de folga sem aniversário;
  • Seguro de vida.

15. Prospectar cooperados e novos negócios, a fim de estreitar o relacionamento com os cooperados e aumentar a capilaridade da sua agência.

20. Buscar informações que possam contribuir para o desenvolvimento estratégico e participação no mercado.

Requisitos

1. Ensino superior completo em Administração, Economia, Tecnólogos da área de Administração/Comercial ou relacionados.

2. Experência em atendimento comercial/clientes no seguimento Pessoa Jurídica.

3. Vivência em instituições financeiras.

4. Domínio com produtos e serviços financeiros.

6. Técnicas de vendas e negociações.

Ações de saúde e bem-estar Adicional por tempo de serviço Assessoria financeira Assessoria jurídica Assistência médica Assistência odontológica Auxílio certificação Anbima - Reembolso 100% da prova Auxílio creche ou babá Auxílio educação de até 80% do valor da mensalidade Comissões sobre vendas Eventos comemorativos Gympass - Convênios com studios, academias e apps de bem-estar Participação nos Resultados (Anual) Prêmios de fim de ano Programas de Desenvolvimento e Coaching Reconhecimento por tempo de cooperativa Seguro de Vida Telenutrição Telepsicologia Universidade corporativa - Cursos e treinamentos Vale alimentação / refeição Vale transporte

Sobre a empresa

Somos o Sicoob Nossacoop, uma instituição completa e sólida para para a vida financeira das pessoas!

Buscamos por pessoas que tenham como objetivo crescer junto e paixão por cooperar.

Nossa missão é gerar soluções financeiras adequadas e sustentáveis aos nossos associados e às suas comunidades por meio do cooperativismo. Diante disso, ampliamos e melhoramos constantemente nosso portfólio de produtos e serviços financeiros visando atender as necessidades dos nossos cooperados pessoas físicas, jurídicas e o agronegócio.

Acreditamos que o cooperativismo tem o poder de transformar o mundo e o nosso compromisso é fortalecer esse movimento proporcionando possibilidades para que as pessoas sejam prósperas, conquistando a autonomia de suas finanças com soluções justas e benéficas em seus negócios e objetivos pessoais.

Ser um cooperado é construir um mundo mais colaborativo, equânime e de pertencimento, responsabilidade social e justiça financeira, sendo todos nós responsáveis pelos alicerces dessa fundação cooperativista.

Estamos há mais de 25 anos no mercado. Presentes em 24 cidades, disponibilizamos mais de 40 agências para atender os nossos cooperados, continuamente empenhados em nossa expansão. Por isso, buscamos por pessoas com paixão e colaborativas, que queiram se conectar e somar esforços para crescermos juntos, que se identifiquem com os nossos valores:

Ética | Respeito | Transparência | Comprometimento | Responsabilidade | Solidariedade.

Se você quer ir além, junte-se a nós!

Valorizamos a diversidade de pensamentos e acreditamos que as diferentes experiências vividas pelas pessoas podem nos tornar ainda mais fortes. Por um mundo mais inclusivo, respeitamos e consideramos em nosso quadro de colaboradores as pessoas como são, independentemente da idade, deficiência, raça, classe social, gênero, orientação sexual e religião.

Esta oportunidade também é destinada a Pessoas com Deficiência (Pcd).

title: Mercado Financeiro – Finance Manager – Grand Hyatt – São Paulo
description:
At Hyatt, we believe our guests select Hyatt because of our caring and attentive associates who are focused on providing authentic hospitality and meaningful experiences to each and every guest. Hyatt is a place where high expectations aren’t just met-they’re exceeded. It’s a place of outstanding rewards, where talent opens doors to exciting challenges in the hospitality industry. Development opportunities and career path options are endless with Hyatt; there is virtually no limit to where your ambition can take you in our world-class organization. Discover your place to shine in our warm, respectful, and inclusive culture.

This position will be responsible for the efficient running of the division in line with Hyatt International’s Corporate Strategies and brand standards, whilst meeting employee, guest and owner expectations. The Finance Manager will ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the Finance & Accounting Division, through planning, organizing, directing and controlling Accounting, Finance and Information Technologies Systems policies and procedures.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and manage the hotel’s annual budget, including revenue projections, expense allocations, and capital expenditure plans.
  • Perform ongoing financial analysis and provide insights on key financial metrics, variances, and trends.
  • Collaborate with department heads to develop and monitor departmental budgets and cost control measures
  • Conduct financial forecasting and modeling to support strategic initiatives and identify potential risks or opportunities.
  • Prepare accurate and timely financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
  • Ensure compliance with accounting principles, corporate policies, and local regulatory requirements.
  • Coordinate internal and external audits, providing necessary documentation and supporting schedules.
  • Monitor and maintain proper internal controls to safeguard hotel assets and ensure accurate financial reporting.
  • Oversee day-to-day financial operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll functions.
  • Supervise the finance team, providing guidance, coaching, and performance evaluations.
  • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial data through regular reconciliations and audits.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality, Accounting, or a related field.
  • Clear, concise written and verbal communication skills in Portuguese and English
  • Proven experience in financial management, preferably within the hospitality industry.
  • Knowledge of local tax laws and regulatory requirements related to finance and accounting.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with people of diverse socioeconomic, cultural, disability, and ethnic backgrounds.
  • Must be proficient in general computer knowledge, including Microsoft Word, Excel & PowerPoint.

title: Dynamics CE Consultant (remote*/Brazil-based)
description:
• Full-time

Company Description

Hitachi Solutions is a global Microsoft solutions integrator passionate about developing and delivering industry-focused solutions that support our clients to deliver on their business transformation goals. Our industry focus, expertise, and intellectual property is what truly sets us apart. We have earned, and continue to maintain, a strategic relationship with Microsoft. Recognized for our achievements - teaming with our clients to deliver innovative digital solutions and services - is how we have achieved year after year recognition.

As their trusted advisor, we support our clients to deliver on their strategic business initiatives as they unify, automate, and modernize their data and operations to increase efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance their customer’s experience. Our over 3,000 team members across 14 countries, and our 18 years of 100% focus on Microsoft technologies and business applications, is how we deliver excellence through expert services and industry-focused cloud solutions.

A part of Hitachi, Ltd., our company has a long and rich history of innovation, financial strength, and international presence of one of the world’s largest companies. Since 1910, Hitachi, Ltd. has been a leader in manufacturing innovative products and solutions that support industry and social infrastructure around the globe supported by 303,000 employees in over 100 countries and across 864 companies.

Job Description

Responsibilities

  • Engage in Dynamics CRM implementations, nurturing the project through all phases from discovery and planning to deployment, ensuring a smooth and inclusive journey for all stakeholders.
  • Serve as a beacon of CRM/CE knowledge, offering insights and guidance to customers and team members, ensuring solutions are tailored to meet client aspirations and needs effectively.
  • Play an active role in uncovering clients' sales, marketing, and customer service needs through empathetic discovery meetings, ensuring a deep understanding of their requirements.
  • Guide and facilitate the design process for key modules, collaborating closely with the Development Team to craft, detail specifications for, and implement customizations. This includes nurturing any custom code or data migration requirements with a focus on utilizing SQL Server Reporting Services.
  • Conduct end-user training sessions with a nurturing approach, fostering learning and competency. Create and maintain comprehensive knowledge transfer documentation to empower clients and ensure sustained success.
  • Innovate and continuously enhance CRM implementation standards and tools, ensuring they are not only effective but also intuitive and user-friendly.
  • Present tailored demonstrations of the technology solution, ensuring they resonate on a personal level and clearly illustrate the value and relevance to the client's unique context.
  • Perform all responsibilities in a manner that reflects and upholds the core values and strengths of the organization, fostering trust and respect within the team and with clients.

Qualifications

  • Possess a deep understanding and expertise in CRM industry practices and products, nurturing client relationships with this knowledge.
  • 3 to 5 years of experience, or involvement in 3+ CRM projects, such as Microsoft CRM, Salesforce, Saleslogix, Onyx, etc., with a requirement of 4+ years or 5+ projects for a Senior CRM Consultant role.
  • Have a good grasp of relational database concepts, fostering the ability to manage and interpret complex information effectively.
  • Exhibit excellent presentation and communication abilities, leading discussions and information sessions with clarity and confidence.
  • Demonstrate exceptional organizational and multitasking talents, coupled with a keen eye for quality, self-motivation, and a heartfelt drive for professional excellence.
  • Be open to domestic and international travel, as necessary, up to 50%, with the understanding that "some" travel will be essential.
  • Microsoft CRM Application certification would be a valuable asset.
  • Experience with Microsoft SharePoint and Business Intelligence is considered advantageous.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or a related field is preferred, underscoring a strong theoretical and practical foundation.
  • Experience with Azure DevOps or similar project management and continuous integration tools.
  • Proficient in Spanish

description:
Senior Software Engineer (Android) - Trabalho Remoto:

At BairesDev, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.

Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.

As a Senior Software Engineer at BairesDev, you will be part of a team that places technological innovation at the center of everything it does. You will apply your extensive experience and skills in Android and have the opportunity to drive creative and novel solutions in a collaborative environment.

What You Will Do:

  1. Write high-quality and maintainable code.
  2. Work independently and collaboratively with minimal supervision in a diverse team.
  3. Address the organization's most challenging technical issues.
  4. Participate in code reviews and testing.
  5. Research and introduce new technologies to enhance applications and the development pipeline.

Here’s what we are looking for:

  1. 6+ years of experience in software development.
  2. 5+ years of experience in Android development (Kotlin or Java).
  3. Solid knowledge of design and architectural patterns.

title: Consultor Sênior de Implantação de Sistemas (ISM) - Espanhol Fluente ou Nativo CLT
description:
Quem somos

Somos uma empresa dedicada à inovação tecnológica, oferecendo uma plataforma SaaS projetada para aprimorar a gestão financeira e contábil dos nossos clientes. Nossa meta é proporcionar uma gestão eficiente e de alto desempenho. Comprometemo-nos a entregar produtos de qualidade excepcional, impulsionados pela nossa busca contínua pela excelência técnica.

Revolucionamos Negócios

Nossa missão é tornar a gestão financeira de alta qualidade acessível a todos, oferecendo análises sofisticadas que transformam a contabilidade e processos financeiros em informações estratégicas para guiar a tomada de decisão.

Do Brasil para o Mundo

A Accountfy é uma empresa brasileira que atende clientes em vários países da América Latina e dos EUA. Temos mais de 500 negócios ativos simultaneamente em nossa base de clientes, incluindo parceiros como Itaú BBA, EY, Ricoh, Grant Thornton, entre outros.

Responsabilidades e Atribuições

  • Liderar e executar projetos de implantação de software de finanças, desde a análise inicial até a finalização.
  • Desenvolver e implementar planos detalhados de implantação, identificando marcos e recursos necessários.
  • Analisar os requisitos de negócios e traduzir essas necessidades em soluções técnicas eficazes.
  • Garantir a correta configuração e integração dos sistemas de software de finanças.
  • Fornecer treinamento e suporte para usuários finais e equipes internas, garantindo uma transição suave para os novos sistemas.
  • Monitorar e relatar o progresso do projeto, garantindo a comunicação eficaz com todas as partes interessadas.
  • Avaliar e documentar a eficácia da implantação, identificando oportunidades de melhoria contínua.
  • Manter-se atualizado com as tendências e melhores práticas em sistemas financeiros e tecnologias de implantação.

Requisitos e Qualificações

  • Necessário ter espanhol fluente ou nativo - será testado em entrevista.
  • Formação superior em Tecnologia da Informação, Engenharia da Computação, Sistemas de Informação, Administração ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Experiência com implantação e integração de sistemas complexos de ERP e financeiros por consultoria;
  • Conhecimento em BP, DRE, DFC, DMPL, DVA e outros demonstrativos, incluindo notas explicativas;
  • Experiência na consolidação de dados financeiros de múltiplas fontes e na geração de relatórios financeiros precisos e informativos, incluindo demonstrações financeiras, relatórios de gerenciamento e análises de tendências;
  • Conhecimento avançado em indicadores/KPIs financeiros;
  • Conhecimento e experiência em metodologia tradicional de gerenciamento de projetos e metodologias ágeis;

Nosso Time

Venha ser um Accountfyer!

Venha fazer parte de um time em constante evolução! Estamos ampliando nossos horizontes e em busca de profissionais talentosos e apaixonados por tecnologia para se juntarem a nós nesta jornada emocionante. Faça sua inscrição agora, enviando seu currículo ou perfil do LinkedIn.

title: Enterprise Architect -Information Architect
description:
Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:

Date: Jul 26, 2024

Location: BAL - SEDE

Requisition Number: 36201

Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for an Enterprise Architect. In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities. Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology, and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster, and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world-class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.

Overview:

We are looking for an experienced leader to join the Enterprise Architecture team in the Business Technology (BT) organization. The Enterprise Architect informs the business domain strategy and translates the strategy into a technical roadmap. The Enterprise Architect will be responsible for defining the overall architecture for their business domain, in alignment with BT’s architectural principles. Additionally, this role will provide expertise and guidance to Product Owners, Business Technology Partners, and Engineers as needed. The Enterprise Architect will report to the Enterprise Architecture Lead.

Essential Functions:

  1. Designs, owns, and maintains the overall business and technical architecture for the domain.
  2. Aligns the domain architecture with the enterprise architecture in accordance with BT’s strategy, and socializes the domain architecture vision, models, and goals.
  3. Defines realistic mid- to long-term (3-5 year) roadmaps and strategy for the domain, with awareness of product backlogs, enterprise resourcing, and interdependencies together with Business Technology Partner (BTP) counterpart.
  4. Establishes or has substantial influence on long-term organization vision and strategy across markets, functions, divisions, regions, and/or countries.
  5. Participates in the development of a multi-year roadmap for the enterprise and architecture strategy.
  6. Examines the company's current business capabilities within the business domain, and aligns the domain architecture with the business capability map.
  7. Reviews, analyzes, and aligns business structures and processes with business goals.
  8. Defines patterns for reuse to drive standardization based on an assessment of capabilities.
  9. Proposes architectural changes to key platforms in order to deliver an industry-leading customer experience.
  10. Works with BTPs and Product/Platform Owners (POs) to align their roadmaps with strengths and opportunities within the technical stack, and continuously identifies new and improved approaches to designing technical solutions.
  11. Supports Product/Platform teams in defining their roadmap for improving engineering practices and quality.
  12. Helps Product/Platform teams surface problems and remove technical impediments.
  13. Shares responsibility with Product Owners for building reusable and scalable components.
  14. Works closely with the procurement team to optimize cost, prevent redundancy, and increase efficiency through continuous process improvement.
  15. Works closely with the security team to ensure compliance with various industry best practices and certifications, identify any gaps in the risk profile of the domain, and take measures to ensure confidentiality, integrity, security, and reliability.

Requirements:

  1. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Business Administration, or equivalent experience in the field.
  2. 10+ years of experience as Solution/Enterprise Architect in a technology/digital organization at a multinational company.
  3. Demonstrated experience building and maintaining business capability maps.
  4. In-depth technological knowledge and experience to incorporate design choices and constraints in the architecture.
  5. Deep understanding of the interdependencies between enterprise strategy and IT developments.
  6. Ability to leverage strong analytical and problem-solving skills to recognize reusable patterns.
  7. Demonstrated ability to influence key business and technology stakeholders (e.g., Product and Platform Owners).
  8. Understanding and knowledge of architectural frameworks such as TOGAF and IAF.
  9. Understanding of risk requirements, security, and reliability at the OS-, middleware-, and application-level.
  10. Driven “leader-doer” that is prepared to roll up their sleeves and not afraid to challenge the status quo.
  11. Willingness to take ownership of responsibilities outside immediate sphere of influence (e.g., business domain).

Preferred Experience & Domain Knowledge:

  • Lead the development and implementation of information architecture strategies across all digital platforms.
  • Conduct user research, stakeholder interviews, and competitive analysis to understand user needs and inform information architecture decisions.
  • Create and maintain sitemaps, user flows, wireframes, taxonomies, metadata schemas, and other IA deliverables.
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Engineers to ensure integration of information architecture and data governance.
  • Develop and maintain documentation of information architecture standards and guidelines.
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest trends and best practices in information architecture and user experience.
  • Mentor and guide team members on information architecture principles and processes.

Present information architecture solutions and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing, and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Director, Account Manager - Fitch Solutions - Brazil
description:
Director, Account Manager - Fitch Solutions - Brazil

Requisition ID: 47008

Business Unit: Fitch Solutions

Category: Business Development & Sales

Location: São Paulo, BR

Date Posted: Sep 23, 2024

Fitch Solutions is looking for a seasoned sales professional to join our team as an Account Manager based out of our Sao Paulo office.

What We Offer:

  • In this high-profile role, you will be responsible for leading the sales effort for Fitch Solutions’ Credit Risk and BMI Solutions across Latin America.
  • Be part of a global leader in credit risk information and strategic data solutions.
  • Excellent opportunity to join a growing team.
  • Exceptional chance for personal development where the chosen candidate will make an immediate impact.

We’ll Count on You To:

  • Creating and implementing a Sales Strategy for Fitch Solutions in the Credit Risk and BMI space, liaising with the necessary internal stakeholders where required.
  • Driving ongoing business sales in Latin America through direct client engagement – including identifying new prospects, initial engagement and the entire sales process (including negotiation and closing agreements).
  • Growing the sales pipeline and increasing the pipeline conversion rate for Credit Risk and BMI Solutions (specific targets will be confirmed).
  • Working closely with other Specialists in Latin America and globally to build a consistent sales approach for Credit Risk and BMI products for new prospects and existing customers.
  • Working closely with the Product team to ensure our value proposition is well crafted for new products and is well connected to our sales opportunity landscape.
  • Accurately reporting revenue forecasts and managing pipeline progression in Salesforce.

What You Need to Have:

  • Strong network within the Latin America financial services community.
  • Significant, demonstrable success in solutions sales.
  • Solid understanding of credit risk and macro environment including a deep knowledge of Credit & Country Risk workflow (risk management requirements in strategic decision making, risk identification, risk quantification/quantitative modelling processes).
  • Significant years’ experience, 4+ years of risk management sales/business development experience within financial and data services.
  • Proven track record in developing existing and new business to grow revenue streams.
  • Able to achieve and exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue targets.
  • Multi-level selling skills and experience dealing across global financial institutions required.
  • Strategic thinking should be a personal strength.
  • Self-motivated and able to generate ideas, demonstrate organizational/time management skills, initiative, tenacity and perseverance.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Fluent in English, Portuguese and Spanish is essential.
  • Travel will be required in this role.

What Would Make You Stand Out:

  • Demonstrate a deep understanding and interest in global affairs.
  • A track record of being a self-starter who is proactive and creative in identifying and developing new business opportunities.
  • A Team player who likes to work hard in a fast-paced environment.
  • Organized and able to multi-task.
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Economics, Business/Finance, or related field or relevant work experience.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment.
  • Knowledge of CRM systems and Salesforce.

Why Fitch?

At Fitch Group, the combined power of our global perspectives is what differentiates us. Our global network of colleagues comes together to accomplish things greater than they ever could alone.

Every team member is essential to our business and each perspective is critical to our success. We embrace a diverse culture that encourages a free exchange of ideas, guaranteeing your voice will be heard and your work will have an impact, regardless of seniority.

We are building incredible things at Fitch and we invite you to join us on our journey.

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.

Fitch Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.

Sobre a empresa

Somos o Sicoob Credinacional!
O desejo da comunidade de construir uma entidade financeira que oferecesse taxas e tarifas mais justas fez com que um grupo de produtores rurais se unissem e criassem uma cooperativa de crédito, hoje o Sicoob Credinacional.
Fundado em 09 de maio de 1988, inicialmente, a cooperativa atendia somente produtores rurais. A partir de 2005 tornou-se uma cooperativa de livre admissão, podendo ter associados, pessoas físicas e jurídicas de qualquer segmento.
O Sicoob Credinacional, atualmente, soma mais de 27 mil cooperados com 12 agências em Minas Gerais distribuídas nas cidades de Abaeté, Belo Horizonte, Betim, Biquinhas, Cedro do Abaeté, Contagem, Paineiras e Quartel Geral, além de um ponto de atendimento digital, levando inclusão financeira e desenvolvimento aos seus cooperados e comunidades.
Fazemos parte do maior Sistema Cooperativo do Brasil. Aqui somos feitos de valores. O cooperativismo é mais que um modelo de negócio: é uma filosofia de vida que busca transformar o mundo em um lugar com melhores oportunidades para todos. Nosso propósito é conectar pessoas para promover justiça financeira e prosperidade.

Se os nossos princípios e valores se encaixam com os seus, venha somar ao nosso negócio para crescermos juntos nessa trajetória de sucesso!

Sobre a empresa

A Sicoob Ouricred faz parte do segundo maior sistema financeiro cooperativo do Brasil, oferecendo uma variedade de produtos e serviços para seus associados.

Nossa história é marcada pela atuação próxima aos nossos cooperados, operamos de forma democrática com os próprios associados participando das decisões estratégicas em assembleias gerais.

Seguimos os princípios do cooperativismo, buscando o desenvolvimento econômico e social dos associados e das comunidades onde estamos inseridos.

A proximidade e compromisso com o desenvolvimento sustentável são marcas registradas do Sicoob, que valoriza a cooperação, a transparência e a responsabilidade social em suas atividades.

title: Coordenador de Vendas
description:
At Blueground , our vision is to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. For us, that means ensuring our guests have the peace of mind, flexibility & confidence they need to explore life’s latest adventure.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013, having raised more than $258m+ in funding, to date -- and that’s just the beginning. We’re now hosting guests in more than 15,000 homes in 32 cities around the world (and growing!), with an aim to hit 100,000 homes in 100 cities by 2025.

Our vision comes to life through our ways of working. For our 1,000+ member team located across 17 countries, we’ve created a culture of collaboration, inclusiveness, and opportunity.

We believe our people should have the power to choose their preferred way to work. Depending on the role’s requirements, team members can choose to work full time in one of our offices, work fully remote, or choose a hybrid model between the two.

We are driven by our core values. To our team, Time is our most important resource. Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our guests and colleagues. Our relationships are built around Transparency , which builds trust and improves communication.

We are looking to recruit a Sales Lead based in São Paulo to join our B2C Inbound Sales department.

Responsabilities:

  • Lead and mentor the sales team, providing guidance and support to ensure high performance.
  • Develop and implement training programs focused on sales techniques and processes.
  • Foster a collaborative and motivated team environment.
  • Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and internal sales data to identify opportunities and threats.
  • Generate and present insightful reports to inform strategic decisions.
  • Analyze pricing and portfolio performance to maximize sales & financial results
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, including marketing, operations, and customer service teams.
  • Build and nurture relationships with external stakeholders, including clients, partners, and vendors.
Requirements:
  • 2-3 years of leadership experience in a sales role (experience in real estate is not required).
  • Proven ability to train and develop sales teams.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders.
  • Ability to build and document processes.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering or a related field (preferred).

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.
